intro: Rechsteineria aggregata, commonly known as the clustered rechsteineria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive umbellate inflorescences. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves that are often aromatic. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable species in botanical studies.
